</main_content># Constitutional Court / Al-Mahkama Al-Dusturiya <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig>
In the Name of His Highness the Amir of Kuwait
Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The Constitutional Court / Al-Mahkama Al-Dusturiya <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig>

In the session held publicly at the Court on 29 Dhu al-Hijjah 1446 AH, corresponding to
25 June 2025 AD
Presided over by Counselor / Adel Ali Al-Bahouh <orig>عادل علي البحوه</orig>, President of the Court
And with the membership of Counselors / Saleh Khalifa Al-Murshed <orig>صالح خليفه المرشد</orig>, Abdul Rahman Mishari Al-Darmi <orig>عبد الرحمن مشاري الدارمي</orig>,
Ibrahim Abdul Rahman Al-Saif <orig>إبراهيم عبد الرحمن السيف</orig>, and Waleed Ibrahim Al-Muajjal <orig>وليد إبراهيم المعجل</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Mohammed Khalid Al-Hussein <orig>محمد خالد الحسين</orig>, Session Secretary
### The following judgment was issued:
Regarding the direct appeal against the unconstitutionality of Articles (32/2) and (34) of Law No. (72) of 2020 concerning Competition Protection, and Articles (29), (42), (43), (44), (45), (46), (49), and (50) of Resolution No. (14) of 2021 regarding the issuance of the Executive Regulations of the Law.

Filed by: Royal International Medical Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة رويال العالمية الطبية</orig>
And registered in the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig> register under number (19) for the year 2024 "Direct Constitutional Challenge".

## Facts
The appellant (Royal International Medical Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة رويال العالمية الطبية</orig>) filed – before this Court – a direct original claim of unconstitutionality against Articles (32/2) and (34) of Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig>, and Articles (29), (42), (43), (44), (45), (46), (49), and (50) of Resolution No. (14) of 2021 regarding the issuance of the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Law. This was done by virtue of a petition filed with the Registry Department <orig>إدارة كتاب</orig> of this Court on 2024/12/22. The appellant stated that the Board of Directors of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig> had referred it to the Disciplinary Board <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> by virtue of Resolution No. (48) of 2014, after attributing to it the refusal to implement the directive issued to it by the Agency under Article (22), paragraph (6) of the aforementioned Law No. (72) of 2020, which grants the Agency the right to address individuals requesting reports and information about their activities and operations. The Disciplinary Board <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> issued its decision to fine the appellant (1%) of its total revenues achieved during the previous fiscal year, based on paragraph (5) of Article (34) of the Law. Since the provisions of this Law are tainted with unconstitutionality, the appellant possesses the locus standi and direct personal interest to file the present challenge. The appellant based its challenge on grounds that Article (32) of the Law – as well as the aforementioned articles of the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> related to the jurisdiction of the Disciplinary Board <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig>, appeals before it, and the enforceability of its decisions – granted the Disciplinary Board <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig>, which it established, the authority to rule on disciplinary accountability referred to it and on appeals filed by concerned parties. This deprived those addressed by the provisions of that Law of their right to a fair trial by resorting to their natural judge, which constitutes an infringement on the right to litigation and a deprivation of fair trial guarantees. Article (34) of the Law allowed the Disciplinary Board <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> to impose financial penalties considered a punishment that should only be imposed by the judicial authority. Furthermore, the fine penalty itself was found to be lacking objectivity and constituting excessiveness disproportionate to the magnitude of the violations for which it was legislated, as it is estimated at a percentage that may reach (10%) of the total revenues of the concerned person during the previous fiscal year in case of violating some provisions of this Law, without any objective criterion for its determination. This represents excessiveness and an infringement on the right to property and the freedom of activity and work without any necessity, whereas the penalty must be proportionate to the acts criminalized, prohibited, or restricted by the legislator. This led the appellant to file the present challenge with its aforementioned requests.
The challenge was presented to this Court – in the consultation chamber – on 2025/5/14, and it was decided to set a session for 2025/5/28 for its consideration. It was considered as indicated in the session minutes. The appellant's representative attended and insisted on the requests contained in the petition of challenge. The representative of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig> submitted a memorandum on behalf of the government, expressing the opinion to reject the challenge. The Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig> in his capacity attended through his representative and submitted a portfolio of documents and a memorandum, requesting at its conclusion a judgment rejecting the challenge. The Court decided to issue the judgment in the challenge in today's session.

### The Court
After reviewing the documents, hearing the pleadings, and deliberation.
It is established that the scope of a direct challenge, in terms of its subject matter, is determined by the texts of the articles challenged for unconstitutionality as stated in the petition of challenge. However, a condition for this is that the challenge must have a direct personal interest in challenging these texts, meaning that the challenged text must have caused harm to the challenger as a result of its application, or that the likelihood of harm to it is probable, such that a judgment of its unconstitutionality would remove this harm and achieve a benefit for it. Given this, and since the appellant's challenge of unconstitutionality focused on Articles (32/2) and (34) of Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig>, and Articles (29), (42), (43), (44), (45), (46), (49), and (50) of the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Law, its personal interest in filing its challenge was represented in the consequences of the Disciplinary Board's <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> decision to fine it (1%) of its total revenues achieved during the previous fiscal year, based on paragraph (5) of Article (34) of the Law, due to its refusal to implement the directive issued to it by

And whereas the objection to the challenged Article (32/2) for including an infringement on the right to litigation and a deprivation of fair trial guarantees is unfounded, it is established – in the jurisprudence of this Court – that the right to litigation for all people is a fundamental constitutional principle, being the means that ensures individuals the protection of their rights, their defense, and the repulsion of aggression against them. It is also included in the generality of this principle to prohibit legislative texts from immunizing any administrative act or decision from judicial review. Consequently, the legislator's regulation of this right legislatively is conditional on not using this regulation as a means to prohibit or undermine it. It is also established that judicial action is issued after an alleged violation of the law, and is decided by a body whose members possess guarantees of impartiality and independence, not being a party to the dispute presented to it, and entrusted with the authority to resolve and settle a judicial dispute without prejudice to the fundamental guarantees that are essentially based on providing an opportunity to realize the defense of its parties and verify their claims on the basis of a legal rule stipulated by the legislator. These characteristics are not available in the administrative decisions issued by the administrative authority imposing financial penalties for violations of a disciplinary nature. These penalties are distinct in their scope of application, procedures, and the competent authority for their imposition from the financial penalties imposed by the judicial authority on perpetrators of crimes whose elements are defined by law. Therefore, there is nothing to prevent the legislator from assigning the jurisdiction to impose these penalties to a Disciplinary Board / Majlis Al-Ta'deeb <orig>مجلس تأديب</orig> whose formation is issued by a decision from the administrative authority, as long as these penalties are necessitated by a necessity that requires their swift imposition on perpetrators of violations prohibited by law.
Given that, and since this Court had previously concluded in its judgment issued on 2025/2/5 in Appeal No. (4) of 2023 "Direct Constitutional Appeal" that: "The Disciplinary Board / Majlis Al-Ta'deeb <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> stipulated in Article (32) of Law No. (72) of 2020 referred to, is established by a decision of the Competent Minister / Al-Wazir Al-Mukhtass <orig>الوزير المختص</orig> and is competent to decide on disciplinary accountability referred to it by the Board of Directors of the Competition Protection Agency / الجهاز حماية المنافسة <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, related to the violations contained in Article (34) of the same law, and only has the power to impose the financial penalties contained in that article in the event that one of these violations is proven to have been committed. It is also competent to decide on appeals filed by stakeholders against competition-related decisions issued by the Board / Al-Majlis <orig>المجلس</orig> – which is the Agency's Board of Directors according to the definition in Article (1) of the Law – without the law obligating it to follow procedures that ensure litigation guarantees before it, then the Agency / Al-Jihaz <orig>الجهاز</orig> shall provide reports and information about its activities. Consequently, the appeal – as is the case – becomes limited in its scope to Articles (32/2) and (34, item 5) of the Law, and Article (29) of the Executive Regulations / Al-La'iha Al-Tanfidhiya <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> related to the powers of the Disciplinary Board / Majlis Al-Ta'deeb <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig>, and Articles (49) and (50) thereof related to the implementation of the Disciplinary Board's / Majlis Al-Ta'deeb's <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> decisions, restricted to them alone and no others. The Court disregards all other items of Article (34) of the Law and Articles (42) to (46) of the Executive Regulations / Al-La'iha Al-Tanfidhiya <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> related to the systems before the Disciplinary Board / Majlis Al-Ta'deeb <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig>, as a judgment of their unconstitutionality – if any – would not achieve any benefit for them.
And whereas Article (32) of Law No. (72) of 2020 concerning Competition Protection / Himayat Al-Munafasa <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig> stipulates that:
"A Disciplinary Board / Majlis Al-Ta'deeb <orig>مجلس تأديب</orig> shall be established by a decision of the Minister / Al-Wazir <orig>الوزير</orig> in the Agency / Al-Jihaz <orig>الجهاز</orig>, consisting of five members from outside the Agency / Al-Jihaz <orig>الجهاز</orig> as follows:
1 – Three judges seconded from the Supreme Judicial Council / Al-Majlis Al-A'la Lil-Qada' <orig>المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig> from among Undersecretaries / Wukala' <orig>وكلاء</orig> or advisors / Mustasharin <orig>مستشارين</orig> of the Court of Appeal / Mahkamat Al-Isti'naf <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig> or the Court of Cassation / Mahkamat Al-Tamyiz <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig>, one of whom shall be the President.
2 – Two members with expertise in economic and legal affairs.
3 – The term of the Disciplinary Board / Al-Majlis Al-Ta'deebi <orig>المجلس التأديبي</orig> shall be three years, renewable once. The decision shall specify the remuneration and allowances of the committee members.
The Disciplinary Board / Al-Majlis Al-Ta'deebi <orig>المجلس التأديبي</orig> shall consider the following matters:
1 – Deciding on disciplinary accountability referred to it by the Board / Al-Majlis <orig>المجلس</orig> related to the violations contained in Article (34) of the provisions of this Law.
2 – Deciding on appeals filed by stakeholders against competition-related decisions issued by the Board / Al-Majlis <orig>المجلس</orig>, and its decisions shall be final.
The Executive Regulations / Al-La'iha Al-Tanfidhiya <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> shall specify the deadlines and procedures for appeals, and the rules and procedures for the work of the Disciplinary Board / Al-Majlis Al-Ta'deebi <orig>المجلس التأديبي</orig>.
Article (34) of the Law stipulates that: "The Disciplinary Board / Al-Majlis Al-Ta'deebi <orig>المجلس التأديبي</orig> may impose financial penalties according to the following:
5 – A percentage not exceeding one percent (1%) of the total revenues achieved by the concerned person during the previous fiscal year for anyone who refrains from implementing any directive issued to them by the Agency / Al-Jihaz <orig>الجهاز</orig> to implement the provisions stipulated in this Law. This is after one month from official notification...".
And whereas the basis of the objection to the text of Articles (32/2) and (34, item 5) mentioned above – as stated in the appeal brief – is that Article (32) included an infringement on the right to litigation and a deprivation of fair trial guarantees, by granting the Disciplinary Board / Majlis Al-Ta'deeb <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> it established the authority to decide on disciplinary accountability referred to it and appeals filed to it by stakeholders, thus depriving those subject to the provisions of that law of their right to a fair trial through recourse to their natural judge, and Article (34) allowed

Given this, and since Law No. (72) of 2020 <orig>القانون رقم (72) لسنة 2020</orig> concerning Competition Protection was issued with the aim of protecting free competition in the Kuwaiti market, addressing behaviors and practices harmful to free competition that damage the national economy, and preventing monopolistic practices in all their forms, and to this end, it authorized the Executive Director of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig> – pursuant to Article (22) thereof – to take necessary measures to facilitate the services provided by the Agency. The Agency undertakes several tasks, including addressing persons subject to the provisions of this Law with requests to submit reports and information about their activities and operations for analysis and to update the general framework for distinguishing between legitimate and illegitimate practices. The Law also authorized the Disciplinary Council <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> to impose financial penalties in case of failure to comply with directives issued by the Agency in this regard. It was a necessary consequence of the foregoing that the determination of the financial penalty imposed in such a case must be proportionate to the act committed, considering that this directive is issued by the Agency with the aim of verifying the actions and activities of the addressed person and whether they have committed an illegitimate practice or not, as no act harmful to free competition has been proven. The Agency's work may even result in no violation being committed. However, the legislator made the penalty imposed in this case estimated at a percentage not exceeding one percent (1%) of the total revenues achieved by the concerned person during the previous fiscal year, despite these revenues having no relation to the committed act and no connection to it. Therefore, it necessitates a determination of the penalty that exceeds the necessity it imposes, detached from the objectives it seeks to achieve, and thus leads to the imposition of that penalty being an unlawful confiscation of funds unrelated to the committed act for which it is imposed, in violation of Articles (16), (18), and (19) of the Constitution. This necessitates a ruling on the unconstitutionality of the aforementioned challenged text.
Since the challenge to Articles (49) and (50) of the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> has become moot after the ruling on the unconstitutionality of the penalty that the Disciplinary Council <orig>مجلس التأديب</orig> may issue, as presented, there is no longer any reason to examine the constitutionality of what the two articles contained for the implementation of the disciplinary decision in this regard.

### For these reasons
The Court ruled: on the unconstitutionality of Clause (5) of Article (34) of Law No. (72) of 2020 <orig>القانون رقم (72) لسنة 2020</orig> concerning Competition Protection, in what it contained regarding the imposition of a financial penalty not exceeding one percent (1%) of the total revenues achieved by the concerned person during the previous fiscal year for anyone who committed the violation stipulated in that clause, and rejected the appeal regarding the remaining challenged articles.
Session Secretary
Court President
In this instance, it is an administrative committee that lacks judicial character, and what it does is not characterized by the nature of judicial work or by a judicial capacity. Furthermore, the decisions it issues in this regard are not considered judicial rulings, nor are they immune from legal oversight. Rather, they are purely administrative decisions subject to the oversight exercised by the judiciary in accordance with its jurisdiction within the framework of the principle of legality. Consequently, conferring the description of finality upon these decisions does not prevent stakeholders from challenging them, nor does it strip the judiciary of its jurisdiction and extend its competence to hear appeals against them to verify their correctness and ascertain their soundness, without it being altered by the inclusion of judicial members in the formation of that council. This alone is not sufficient to confer judicial character upon it, because the criterion for conferring this character is the nature of the work it performs and the guarantees of litigation stipulated by law to be followed before it. Therefore, the claim that the texts of the two challenged articles violate the right to litigation is dismissed," and the Court reached the same conclusion in its judgment issued in the same session in Appeal No. (5) of 2023 <orig>الطعن رقم (5) لسنة 2023</orig> "Direct Constitutional Appeal."
Given the foregoing, and since the similar grounds for appeal related to Article (32/2) of the Law and Article (29) of the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> do not, in their generality, deviate from the grounds raised in the two aforementioned appeals, and the two judgments issued therein provided a response to them, the appeal against them is therefore not based on a sound constitutional basis.
As for the challenge to the penalty contained in Clause (5) of Article (34) of the challenged Law, due to its excessiveness and disproportionality with the committed violations, it is fundamentally sound. This is because the essence of legislative texts is their logical connection to their objectives, considering that any legislative regulation is not an end in itself, but merely a means to achieve those objectives. While the legislator, by virtue of their discretionary power in accordance with the Constitution, has the authority to define the acts that are prohibited or whose exercise is restricted, and the penalties to be imposed in case of violation of the provisions they establish, whether administrative, punitive, or financial, the condition for this is not to prejudice the controls and guarantees enshrined in the Constitution, which represent a safeguard for protecting rights of all kinds, and which do not lead to their annulment or derogation. Therefore, in exercising their discretionary power in determining these penalties, they may not undermine the necessity of their imposition to address the committed violations, their proportionality to the gravity of those violations and the resulting harm, and their consistency with the objective sought by their establishment. If these limits are exceeded, they would be unjustified.
Since private property is one of the rights guaranteed by the Constitution, which has surrounded it with essential guarantees to prevent its infringement, no one may be prevented from disposing of their property except within the limits of the law, and no one's property may be expropriated except for public interest in the cases specified by law, provided that fair compensation is paid. General confiscation of funds is prohibited, and the penalty of specific confiscation may only be by judicial order in the cases specified by law. This protection guaranteed by the Constitution for private property extends to all funds, and they may not be touched except by way of exception, and within the limits

After reviewing the application and the attached documents:

Whereas the facts of the case are summarized in the bankruptcy judge's decision dated 13/10/2024 to commence restructuring procedures regarding the application submitted by: 1- Sunny Side Up Company (One-Person Company) <orig>شركة صني سايد أب (شركة الشخص الواحد)</orig>, 2- Faisal Ahmed Yousef Al-Saeed <orig>فيصل أحمد يوسف السعيد</orig>, with a suspension of all judicial claims and enforcement procedures taken against them until the date of issuance of a decision regarding the restructuring plan, and setting 1/7/2024 as a temporary date for the suspension of payments. And appointing Mr./Dr. Faleh Al-Azmi <orig>د. فالح العازمي</orig> as the restructuring trustee.

And whereas the bankruptcy judge issued the decision dated 5/6/2025 to replace the restructuring trustee, Mr./Dr. Faleh Al-Azmi <orig>د. فالح العازمي</orig>, and appoint Mr./Dr. Sabah Mubarak Al-Jalawi <orig>د. صباح مبارك الجلاوي</orig> as the restructuring trustee.

In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law, decisions issued by the bankruptcy judge shall be executive instruments according to this law, and the Bankruptcy Department shall affix the executive formula to them, making them enforceable immediately upon their issuance and without declaration.

And whereas the bankruptcy judge issued the decision dated 6/1/2025 to extend the period for preparing and depositing the restructuring plan until 13/7/2025.

And whereas the trustee submitted his letter dated 7/6/2025, announcing the report on restructuring operations and the provisional list of debts, and a statement of accepted and excluded debts.

### Legal Basis:
And whereas Articles (1, 105, 110) of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 stipulate that: "In the application of the provisions of this Law, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings specified opposite each of them... Trustee: A person licensed by the Authority or registered with it in the register of auditors who undertakes the tasks specified in this Law..."

"Announcement: An announcement in two local daily newspapers, one of which is published in English..."

"... "The Bankruptcy Department shall notify the trustee of the decision issued for his appointment within ten days from its date of issuance, and shall provide him with all available information about the debtor. The trustee shall, within ten days from the date of notification of his appointment decision, do the following:"

1- Announce a summary of the decision issued to commence the procedures, provided that the announcement includes an invitation to creditors to submit their claims and supporting documents and deliver them within a period not exceeding one month from the date of the announcement.
2- Notify all creditors whose electronic addresses are known to him to provide him with claims and documents within one month from the date of announcing the summary of the decision to commence procedures. The debtor must provide the trustee with any additional details not notified to the Bankruptcy Department, whether concerning his creditors or debt amounts, and details of any contracts under execution and any pending or ongoing judicial proceedings in which the debtor is a party, within the timeframe specified by the trustee." "The trustee must verify the debts within one month from the date of expiry of the period specified in clauses (1, 2) of Article (105) of this Law, and may seek assistance from the Bankruptcy Committee or the debtor in doing so. After completing the verification of debts, the trustee shall deposit with the Bankruptcy Department a list of debts that includes the names of creditors and the amount due to each of them as of the date of commencement of procedures, their documents, the reasons for disputing their debt, and his opinion regarding its acceptance or rejection. It shall also include the names of creditors who hold special securities over the debtor's assets, a statement of the amount due to each of them as of the date of commencement of procedures, and a statement of the securities provided to each of them and their estimated value as of the date of the procedures. The trustee shall, within ten days following the deposit of the list of debts, announce the list and state the amounts he deems acceptable for each debt and those he deems rejected. Debts owed to the government due to taxes or fees of all kinds shall be considered accepted debts without the need for the trustee's audit, even if they are subject to dispute by the debtor or others, and the value of these debts shall be adjusted in light of any final judgments issued concerning them."

Therefore, we decided the following:
Permission is granted to publish the provisional list of debts in two local daily newspapers, one of which is in English, and to publish it in the Official Gazette. The publication deadline shall not exceed one month from this date.

Secretary
Bankruptcy Judge

After reviewing the application and the attached documents:

Whereas the brief facts indicate that the respondent company is one of the companies that has been engaged in commercial activity since 1971, with a capital of fifteen million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, and specializes in general contracting activities. It has previously executed numerous projects for official entities in the State, in addition to executing several projects outside the State. Given that the COVID-19 pandemic cast its shadow over commercial activities, leading many companies, including the respondent company, to falter in meeting their obligations. The respondent company had recently succeeded in securing some projects that would enable it to settle its obligations, provided it operates financially and is given sufficient time to do so. The applicant contributed to helping the respondent company overcome its difficulties by granting it the sum of K.D. 285,000 (two hundred and eighty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) during the COVID-19 period. Although the respondent company was able to resume its operations and activities and secured several projects, which prompted the applicant to formally demand that the respondent company fulfill its outstanding obligations, the respondent company nevertheless refrained from settling the amount recorded as due. The debt owed by the respondent company to the applicant was confirmed by bank documents and the respondent company's acknowledgment of the debt balance.

Pursuant to Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be enforceable instruments in accordance with this law. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall affix the enforcement formula to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon issuance and without notification.

The applicant included in its application some of the documents required for initiating restructuring procedures, as stipulated in the provisions of Law No. 71/2020 <orig>القانون رقم 2020/71</orig> concerning Bankruptcy <orig>الإفلاس</orig> and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig>, the most important of which are:
- 1- The Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and its amendments, and the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> of the respondent company.
- 2- The financial statements of the respondent company for the fiscal years 2022/2023/2024.
- 3- Lawsuits and judicial judgments issued against the respondent company.
- 4- A document confirming the validity of a balance dated 1/1/2025, which includes the debtor company's acknowledgment of a balance of K.D. 285,000 in favor of the applicant, outstanding until 31/12/2024, with an attached notification from the applicant to the respondent company instructing it to fulfill its obligations on 1/2/2025.

Whereas the respondent company appeared before the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> regarding the application, and its representative submitted a defense memorandum concluding with a request for a decision to initiate restructuring procedures and suspend claims.
Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued a decision dated 11/5/2025 requesting the completion of the necessary documents for initiating the application procedures.
Whereas the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued a decision dated 2/6/2025 to address the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> for its opinion on the current application.
Whereas the respondent company appeared before the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> regarding the application, and its representative submitted unsegregated documents containing:
- 1- A list of creditors' names, details, and the amount of debt owed to each.
- 2- A report on the company's business viability for continuity.
- 3- The approval of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of the respondent company to initiate restructuring procedures.
- 4- A proposal for the appointment of Mr. Dr. Abdulaziz Nasser Al-Rashidi <orig>عبدالعزيز ناصر الرشيدي</orig> as Restructuring Trustee <orig>أميناً لإعادة الهيكلة</orig>. The aforementioned's consent is attached. And whereas it was confirmed from reviewing the register of auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات</orig> registered with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> that Mr. Dr. Abdulaziz Nasser Al-Rashidi <orig>عبدالعزيز ناصر الرشيدي</orig> is one of those registered with the Department.

**Legal Basis:**
Whereas it is stipulated in Articles (1, 25, 29, 32, 33, 34, 97, 102) of Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> No. 71/2020 <orig>القانون رقم 2020/71</orig> that: "In the application of the provisions of this Law, the following words and phrases shall have the meanings assigned to them respectively: ... Suspension of Claims <orig>وقف المطالبات</orig>: The suspension of any lawsuit or enforcement procedure initiated against the debtor when it relates to their assets or debts... Debts subject to the supervision of the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>: These are the debts of companies listed on the stock exchange, and any other debts that the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> assigns the Committee to supervise." The Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of being notified of the application – unless the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> specifies a shorter or longer period – assess the debtor's situation regarding the debts under its supervision, and submit a report to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> concerning it, which shall include the following matters:
- 1- The possibility of preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> or restructuring <orig>إعادة الهيكلة</orig>.
- 2- Whether urgent precautionary measures <orig>تدابير تحفظية</orig> should be taken, and the justification for such.
- 4- Whether the debtor is capable of managing their own affairs and assets, or if the interest of the debtor and creditors requires that the management of the debtor's affairs and assets be entrusted to a trustee... " The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall decide on the application, within ten days from the expiry of the period specified for responding to it, by issuing a decision to initiate preventive settlement <orig>التسوية الوقائية</orig> procedures or

The applicant had submitted an application to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> for initiating restructuring procedures for the respondent company on 27/4/2025, along with the suspension of all claims effective from the date of the decision to initiate procedures until the date of approval of the restructuring plan, and the approval of the restructuring plan.

The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence, reject, or not accept the proceedings, shall publish and announce the decision, notify the concerned parties, disclose it on the Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> if the debtor is listed, and instruct the debtor to disclose it on their website, unless the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to suffice with any of these methods or others. "If the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to accept the commencement of restructuring proceedings or declare bankruptcy, the trustee nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and whose fees have been assessed in accordance with the provisions of this law shall be appointed in the same decision. "...". The debtor, creditors, and the regulatory authority may submit a request to commence restructuring proceedings according to the following controls: 1- The debtor has ceased payment. 2- If the debtor is in a state of financial deficit. 3- The debtor's business must be viable for continuity." "The issuance of a decision to commence restructuring proceedings results in the suspension of claims starting from the day following the date of this decision until the date of approval of the restructuring plan. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall provide the debtor, upon request, with a certificate of suspension of these claims."
Therefore, we have decided the following:
First: Commencement of restructuring proceedings regarding the request filed against: Al-Hamra Kuwaiti Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة الحمراء الكويتية ذ.م.م</orig>, with the suspension of all judicial claims and enforcement procedures taken against it until the date of issuance of a decision regarding the restructuring plan, and setting February 1, 2025, as a temporary date for the cessation of payments.
Second: Appointment of the auditor / Dr. Abdulaziz Nasser Al-Rashidi <orig>د. عبد العزيز ناصر الرشيدي</orig> as trustee for the restructuring, with the decision on his fees deferred. He shall commence his duties from the date of this decision until a final decision is made regarding the request, and he shall inventory the debtor's assets and properties, take all necessary precautionary measures, and prepare a list of debts.
The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall notify the applicant, the respondent, the creditors, and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> of this decision in accordance with Article (55) of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020, and publish it in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>. The debtor company is tasked with preparing a restructuring proposal and forming a creditors' committee within the legally prescribed period.

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (140) of 2025
Regarding the Addition of Contact Information in the Commercial Register and Commercial License
Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>:
Having reviewed:
*   Decree-Law No. 38 of 1980 issuing the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig> and its amending laws,
*   Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 issuing the Commercial Law <orig>قانون التجارة</orig> and its amending laws,
*   Law No. (32) of 1982 regarding the Civil Information System <orig>نظام المعلومات المدنية</orig>,
*   Law No. 111 of 2013 regarding Commercial Activity Licenses <orig>تراخيص الحالات التجارية</orig> and its executive regulations and amendments,
*   Law No. 20 of 2014 regarding Electronic Transactions <orig>المعاملات الإلكترونية</orig>,
*   Law No. 1 of 2016 issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its executive regulations and amendments,
*   Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activity and its executive regulations and amendments,
*   Decree No. (191) of 2015 regarding the Organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
*   Law No. 18 of 2018 regarding the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>,
*   And Decision No. 580 of 2018 issuing the Executive Regulations of Law No. 18 of 2018 regarding the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and its amendments,
*   Decree No. (73) of 2024 forming the Ministry and its amending decrees,
*   And Ministerial Decision No. (161) of 2016 regarding the Establishment and Competencies of the One-Stop Shop Department <orig>إدارة النافذة الواحدة</orig>,
*   And based on what was presented by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>,
*   And based on what the public interest dictates.
Has decided
### Article One
Item No. (15) shall be added to the text of Article (2) of the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. (580) of 2018, with the following text:
"15- Contact information, which includes mobile phone number and email address, and any modern electronic communication method may be added thereto."
### Article Two
All those registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> must submit requests to amend their status to comply with Article One of this Decision within six months from the date of its publication.

# Ministerial Resolution No. (141) of 2025
Amending Ministerial Resolution No. (192) of 2020
Regarding the Appointment of a Compliance Officer for Entities Subject to the Supervision of
the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> in Implementation of the Requirements of Law No.
(106) of 2013 Regarding Combating Money Laundering
and Terrorism Financing

## Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (106) of 2013 regarding Combating Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing, and its Executive Regulations and amendments,
- Ministerial Resolution No. (409) of 2013 regarding the Controls and Instructions Regulating the Work of Exchange Institutions and Companies,
- Ministerial Resolution No. (430) of 2016 regarding the Controls Regulating the Work of Institutions and Companies Engaged in Real Estate Brokerage and Real Estate Offices with regard to Combating Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing,
- Ministerial Resolution No. (431) of 2016 regarding the Controls Regulating the Work of Institutions and Companies Operating in the Field of Trading Gold, Precious Stones, and Precious Metals with regard to Combating Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing,
- Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> Resolution No. (141) of 2023 regarding the Executive Regulations for Implementing Security Council Resolutions Issued under Chapter VII of the United Nations Charter related to Combating Terrorism and Financing the Proliferation of Weapons of Mass Destruction,
- What was presented by the Undersecretary of the Ministry,
- And based on what the public interest dictates.
Has decided:

## Article One
(Definitions)
- The Concerned Department: Anti-Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing Department <orig>إدارة مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig>.
- Companies and Institutions: These are the activities addressed by the Executive Regulations of Law No. (106) of 2013 regarding Combating Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing, namely (companies and institutions engaged in real estate brokerage - and companies and institutions operating in the trade of gold, precious stones, and precious metals).
- Compliance Officer: A person appointed by financial institutions and designated non-financial businesses and professions subject to the supervision of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, and is responsible for implementing the requirements of the Law, its Executive Regulations, and relevant Ministerial Resolutions.

## Article Two
(Conditions for Appointment)
Companies and institutions addressed by Law No. (106) of 2013 regarding Combating Money Laundering and Terrorism Financing must adhere to the following conditions when appointing a Compliance Officer:
1. Must be of Kuwaiti nationality.

## Article Three
The contact information of the aforementioned company or institution shall be considered essential data required for the commercial license and an integral part thereof, and a condition for its issuance or renewal, in a manner that ensures the completion of all notifications and correspondence.
All companies and institutions must update their license data to include modern contact methods within a period of six months from the date of publication of this Resolution.

## Article Four
Those authorized with judicial enforcement powers, in accordance with Law No. (18) of 2018 and its Executive Regulations, may seize violations of Articles One and Two and verify the accuracy of data.

## Article Five
The issuance or renewal of the license shall be suspended until compliance with the provisions of Article Three of this Resolution.

## Article Six
All competent authorities – each within its jurisdiction – shall implement this Resolution, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

## Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبدالله العجيل</orig>

- And Law No. 8 of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم 2010/8</orig> concerning the rights of persons with disabilities and its amendments.
- And on the letter from the General Department of Nationality and Kuwaiti Travel Documents <orig>الإدارة العامة للجنسية ووثائق السفر الكويتية</orig> No. 8676 dated 2/6/2025 and its attachments.
- And based on the presentation of the Acting Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة بالتكليف</orig>.
Decided

### Article (1)
The individual / Mahmoud Jamal Mahmoud Hassan Mohammed <orig>محمود جمال محمود حسن محمد</orig> – son of citizen / Fatima Ahmed Al-Sheikh Aqeel Mohammed Al-Farsi <orig>فاطمة أحمد الشيخ عقيل محمد الفارسي</orig> – shall be treated as a Kuwaiti for life, in accordance with the provisions of Article (3) of the aforementioned Law No. 8 of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم 2010/8</orig>.

### Article (2)
Those concerned shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

First Deputy Prime Minister <orig>النائب الأول لرئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>
and Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig>
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

2. Must not be less than 21 years of age.
3. Must be familiar with Law No. (106) of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم (106) لسنة 2013</orig> on Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing <orig>مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig> and related ministerial decisions.
4. Must not have been convicted of a crime against honor or trust, unless his reputation has been restored.
5. Must be proficient in computer skills and electronic systems.

### Article Three
(Duties of the Compliance Officer <orig>مراقب الالتزام</orig>)
The Compliance Officer <orig>مراقب الالتزام</orig> must supervise the company's or institution's <orig>الشركة أو المؤسسة</orig> implementation of the requirements of the law, its executive regulations, and related ministerial decisions, including the following:
1. Preparing work policies and procedures, internal systems and controls related to combating money laundering and terrorist financing <orig>مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig>, commensurate with the size and scope of work of the company or institution <orig>الشركة أو المؤسسة</orig>, provided they are approved by senior management <orig>الإدارة العليا</orig> and submitted to the relevant department <orig>الإدارة المعنية</orig> upon request.
2. Preparing and updating a risk assessment study for clients and transactions <orig>تقييم مخاطر العملاء والمعاملات</orig> and submitting it to the relevant department <orig>الإدارة المعنية</orig> upon request.
3. Reviewing suspicion indicators specific to the commercial establishment <orig>المنشأة التجارية</orig>, and establishing a mechanism for notifying the Kuwaiti Financial Intelligence Unit <orig>وحدة التحريات المالية الكويتية</orig> of suspicious transactions <orig>العمليات المشبوهة</orig> and retaining notifications for submission to the relevant department <orig>الإدارة المعنية</orig> upon request.
4. Establishing a mechanism for informing the Committee for the Implementation of Security Council Resolutions <orig>لجنة تنفيذ قرارات مجلس الأمن</orig> in the event of providing a service to an individual listed on international or national sanctions lists.
5. Training employees of the company or institution <orig>الشركة أو المؤسسة</orig> to ensure the implementation of obligations stipulated by law.
6. Retaining records, transactions, and studies and submitting them to the relevant department <orig>الإدارة المعنية</orig> upon request.
7. Implementing simplified and enhanced due diligence measures <orig>تدابير العناية الواجبة المخففة والمشددة</orig> on clients and the ultimate beneficial owner <orig>المستفيد الفعلي</orig>.
8. Personal attendance at the relevant department <orig>الإدارة المعنية</orig> to complete required data.
The provisions contained in the law and related ministerial decisions shall apply to all local and foreign branches and their subsidiaries, and the company or institution <orig>الشركة أو المؤسسة</orig> must be aware of all relevant laws and decisions in that country.

### Article Four
(Change of Compliance Officer <orig>مراقب الالتزام</orig>)
The manager of the company or institution <orig>الشركة أو المؤسسة</orig> must notify the relevant department <orig>الإدارة المعنية</orig> in case of a change in the Compliance Officer <orig>مراقب الالتزام</orig> and update the necessary data accordingly.

### Article Five
All provisions contrary to this decision shall be repealed.

### Article Six
Officials – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبدالله العجيل</orig>

# Ministerial Decision No. 1222 of 2025
## Regarding: Treatment as a Kuwaiti Citizen

The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior
- Having reviewed Amiri Decree No. 15/59 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law and its amending laws.

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Decision No. PAI (87) of 2025
### Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General <orig>المدير العام بالتكليف</orig>
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law and its Executive Regulations and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Decision No. (2025/5) issued on 9/3/2025, delegating the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department <orig>قسم التفتيش الصناعي</orig> No. (A4-124) issued on 23/12/2024, which includes the following violation committed by Messrs. / Al-Arabiya Advertisements for Publicity and Advertising <orig>إعلانات العربية للدعاية والإعلان</orig>:
    - Practicing blacksmithing work without an industrial license.
*   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (2025/2/496) held on 19/1/2025.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has Decided
### Article One
To close / Solution No. (18) located in Plot No. (60) in East Al-Ahmadi <orig>شرق الأحمدي</orig> area – Block (8), belonging to Messrs. / Al-Arabiya Advertisements for Publicity and Advertising <orig>إعلانات العربية للدعاية والإعلان</orig> – until the violation and its consequences are removed.

### Article Two
In the event that the violation is not removed after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

### Article Three
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالإنابة</orig>
Issued on: 24 June 2025 AD

A material error also occurred in the text of Article 4 and Article 5 of Decree-Law No. 79 of 2025 concerning international judicial cooperation in criminal matters, published in the aforementioned issue:

or its description or elements.
2- That the crime is punishable, or that a sentence of deprivation of liberty for a period of not less than one year has been imposed for it, under the laws of both the requesting and requested states.
3- That the execution of the extradition request does not result in the punishment of the person to be extradited for the same crime twice.
### Article (5)
Extradition is not permissible in the following cases:
1- If the person to be extradited is of Kuwaiti nationality. In this case, they shall be referred to the competent investigation and prosecution authority if the extradition request meets the conditions stipulated in the preceding article.
2- If the execution of the extradition request conflicts with the sovereignty of the state, its national security, or its public order.
3- If the law grants jurisdiction to the competent judicial authority of the state regarding the crime for which extradition is requested.
4- If the crime subject to the extradition request is a political crime or related to a political crime.
Terrorism crimes, war crimes, crimes of genocide, crimes against the Head of State, a member of their family, their deputy, or other persons enjoying international protection, as well as crimes against state facilities and its political interests, are not considered political crimes.
5- If the crime for which extradition is requested is limited to a breach of military duties.
6- If there are serious reasons to believe that the extradition request is intended to prosecute or punish the person to be extradited for reasons related to their ethnic origin, religion, nationality, or political opinions.
7- If the person to be extradited has already been tried for the same crime for which extradition is requested and was acquitted, or convicted and has served the imposed sentence.
8- If the person to be extradited is under investigation or trial in the state for the same crime for which extradition is requested.
9- If the crime or the penalty associated with the crime for which extradition is requested has lapsed according to the law of the state where it was committed, in terms of prescription.
10- If the person to be extradited has been or may be subjected in the requesting state to torture, inhuman or degrading treatment, or a cruel punishment disproportionate to the crime committed, or will not be afforded the guarantees of a fair trial stipulated in international covenants.
Therefore, it was necessary to make this clarification.

### Article (4)
Extradition is subject to the following conditions:
1- That the crime for which extradition is requested is punishable under the laws of both the requesting state and the requested state.
It is not required for the crime to be considered punishable under the laws of both countries that its designation be identical

## Tender No. (2024/115/DA)

License for the exploitation, management, and operation of an investment site in Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig>, Phase One (local restaurant), Site No. (5)
**Local Burger Concept**

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the launch of Tender No. (2024/115/DA) (2025) for the license to exploit, manage, and operate an investment site in Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig>, Phase One (local restaurant), Site No. (5) Local Burger Concept. Those wishing to participate, from companies or institutions specialized in this field, should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and tender documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7 - Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>), starting from the date of publication of the announcement in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars only (K-Net payment only) for the booklet. Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises are exempted from these fees (upon submission of the relevant certificate). From 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 31/7/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7.
3- Submission of an initial security deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4- Submission of a valid national labor percentage compliance certificate.
5- A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company's representative to purchase the tender document.
6- This tender is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The bidder must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8- The site inspection and preliminary meeting will be held on Monday, 28/7/2025, at 11:00 AM in Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig>, Phase One.

Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the tender for Practice No.: WA / 923 / 2025-2026 regarding the maintenance of servers and telephone communication systems for the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> and all its affiliated sites, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be purchased from the Ministry of Information's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> website via the barcode attached to the announcement, starting from Sunday, 20/7/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (50 K.D.) fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only. Bids must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> in sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the bid value (which should be valid for the entire bid validity period of 90 days). The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside, avoiding any mention of the practitioner's name or any identifying reference. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 7/8/2025.
*   The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Sunday, 27/7/2025, at 11:00 AM at the office of Mr. / Assistant Undersecretary for Engineering Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد للشئون الهندسية</orig> – Media Complex <orig>مجمع الإعلام</orig> – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> – Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything discussed in the meeting will be considered an integral part of the practice documents and will be binding on bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all practitioners before the bid closing date.

Announcement

Bids must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> in sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the bid value (which should be valid for the entire bid validity period of 90 days). The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside, avoiding any mention of the practitioner's name or any identifying reference. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Wednesday, 6/8/2025.
*   The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Monday, 28/7/2025, at 11:00 AM at the office of Mr. / Assistant Undersecretary for Engineering Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد للشئون الهندسية</orig> – Media Complex <orig>مجمع الإعلام</orig> – Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> – Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything discussed in the meeting will be considered an integral part of the practice documents and will be binding on bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all practitioners before the bid closing date.

*   All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, 3 copies, except for:
    1.  Bid form, paper copy.
    2.  Initial security deposit, paper copy.
    3.  Copy of the purchase receipt, paper copy.
    4.  Practitioner data form, paper copy.
*   The practice is indivisible, and alternative bids will not be accepted.
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for practitioners wishing to attend the bid opening session, after coordinating with the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> before the scheduled date of the bid opening session.
*   A valid national labor compliance certificate <orig>شهادة استيفاء العمالة الوطنية</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate <orig>شهادة لمن يهمه الأمر</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to repeated violations of Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a certificate of payment of contributions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article No. 95 of the Social Insurance Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>.
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempt from the prescribed fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the text of Article 39 of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on 10/7/2025
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of the Integrated Logistics Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>الشركة المتكاملة اللوجستية (ش م ك م)</orig> was held on Thursday, 10/7/2025, at 10:30 AM at the company's headquarters, in the presence of shareholders owning 150 million shares, representing 100% of the company's capital, and in the presence of the Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Saleh Sulaiman Saleh Al-Huwaiti <orig>صالح سليمان صالح الحويطي</orig>, and Mr. Mohammed Bandar Al-Khawwas <orig>محمد بندر الخواص</orig> from Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>. The Chairman of the General Assembly began by welcoming the attendees and announcing the attendance percentage, then proceeded to review the agenda as follows:
Unanimous approval by the attendees on the items of the Extraordinary General Assembly:
1- Approval of the amendment to Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article No. (4) of the Company's Memorandum of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:

Current Text (Before Amendment):-
The purposes for which the company was established are to carry out the following:
1- Carrying out all land transport operations and goods of all types, including liquid, solid, and bulk materials, in Kuwait or abroad, and performing all operations that serve or are related to land transport activities.
2- Owning various means of land transport, such as cars and others, spare parts, and maintenance workshops, or completing their parts, and leasing and renting these means by various methods.
3- Owning, leasing, and renting real estate and land necessary to serve various types of activities carried out by the company and included in its objectives, and customs clearance operations for imported and exported goods, and packaging goods of all types.
4- The company carrying out handling operations for all goods, including hazardous and dangerous materials, and establishing warehouses of all forms, equipped with cranes.
5- Importing and selling all equipment, materials, and accessories necessary for the company's purposes.
6- Establishing and leasing buildings necessary for the purposes of maritime transport services and crafts of all types, services, workshops, and dry docks for steamers, and acting as agents for steamer companies and land transport for passengers of all types.
7- Owning private means of transport for passengers.
8- Owning and leasing heavy equipment and transport equipment of various types.
9- Providing all services, including ground services and support for passengers, aircraft, and cargo.
10- Establishing warehouses of all forms (refrigerated warehouses - dry warehouses) and creating areas and spaces for storing goods, raw materials, and primary materials of all types, including car storage yards and other heavy equipment.
11- Managing and maintaining warehouses, supervising the protection of inventory therein, and providing packaging, wrapping, and assembly services for materials, goods, and merchandise intended for marketing.
12- Leasing warehouses and managing inventory for others.
13- Storing all types of goods according to the customs supervision deposit system inside or outside customs zones, and engaging in all customs handling activities.
14- Equipping warehouses with the necessary installations, means, and cranes for arranging goods and moving them within the warehouse area, and establishing and leasing buildings for the company's purposes.
15- Managing stagnant and obsolete inventory by selling all types of commodity inventory inside and outside the State of Kuwait, and arranging special auctions for its disposal.
16- Practicing all e-commerce activities and supporting activities in accordance with the company's activity.
17- Performing computer-related work, such as designing various systems, in accordance with the company's activity.

## Kuwaiti National Marketing Company K.S.C. (Closed) Under Liquidation
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on 30/6/2025

On Monday, 30/6/2025, at 12:00 PM, the Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Kuwaiti National Marketing Company K.S.C. (Under Liquidation) held its meeting at the office of the company's liquidator, located in (Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> - Ali Al-Salem Street <orig>شارع علي السالم</orig> - Al-Nuwai Building <orig>عمارة النوي</orig> - Third Floor).
Mr. Barrak Abdul Hassan Al-Otaiqi <orig>براك عبد الحسن العتيقي</orig>, in his capacity as the liquidator of Kuwaiti National Marketing Company K.S.C., chaired the meeting session.
The meeting was attended by the representative of the audit firm, Mr. Ali Mohammed Kohari <orig>علي محمد كوهري</orig> – Al-Salhiya Certified Accountants <orig>مكتب الصالحية محاسبون قانونيون</orig>, and shareholders holding 11,460,000 shares in person and by proxy, representing 76.4% of the total capital shares of 15,000,000 shares.
Mr. Barrak Abdul Hassan Al-Otaiqi <orig>براك عبد الحسن العتيقي</orig>, the company's liquidator, opened the meeting and announced the completion of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting. He then proceeded to discuss the item mentioned in the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly. The Extraordinary General Assembly unanimously approved, with 100% of the attendees, the item mentioned in the agenda as follows:
1- The extension of the liquidation period for Mr. Barrak Abdul Hassan Al-Otaiqi <orig>براك عبد الحسن العتيقي</orig> – Certified Accountants, to complete the liquidation work for a period of one year only, was approved. The liquidator requested a reduction in his fees to 2,000 K.D. (Two Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) annually, taking into consideration the company's situation, and the Assembly approved this.
At the conclusion of the meeting, Mr. Barrak Abdul Hassan Al-Otaiqi <orig>براك عبد الحسن العتيقي</orig> – Chairman of the Meeting, thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting concluded at 12:15 PM.

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on 7/7/2025
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig> of the shareholders of Kuwait Gateway Electronic Services Company <orig>شركة بوابة الكويت للخدمات الإلكترونية</orig> – a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company – held its meeting at 10:00 AM on Monday, 7/7/2025, at the company's headquarters – Crystal Tower, 22nd Floor – Meeting Room.

Current Text
Distribution of net profits shall be as follows:

stop this deduction if the reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.

### Al-Mana Holding Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة المانع القابضة</orig>
#### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting <orig>محضر اجتماع الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig>
#### Held on 26/06/2025
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية غير العادية</orig> of Al-Mana Holding Group Company <orig>شركة مجموعة المانع القابضة</orig> held its meeting at 10:00 AM on Thursday, 26/06/2025, at the company's headquarters, chaired by Mr. Nasser Abdul Latif Nasser Al-Mana <orig>ناصر عبد اللطيف ناصر المانع</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> announced the availability of the legal quorum for the meeting, with the attendance of shareholders owning (48,400,000) shares in person, representing 100% of the company's total capital of (KWD 4,840,000) equivalent to (48,400,000) shares.
- Then, the items on the agenda were reviewed as follows:
- Approval of the alignment of local activities with international activities.
- Approval of the amendment of Article 6 of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article 4 of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:
**Text Before Amendment:**
Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Managing its subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing the necessary support to them.
2- Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities.
3- Financing and lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
4- Owning industrial property rights, such as patents, industrial trademarks, or any related rights, and leasing them to other companies for exploitation, whether inside or outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>.
5- Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law.
6- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies. The company may engage in auxiliary, complementary, or necessary activities related to its purposes. The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.
**Text After Amendment:**
1- Managing its subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing the necessary support to them - Activity Code 642010
2- Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities – Activity Code 642020
3- Financing and lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20% - Activity Code 642040
4- Owning intellectual property rights, such as patents, industrial trademarks, or any related rights, and leasing them to other companies for exploitation, whether inside or outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> - Activity Code 642050
5- Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law - Activity Code 642030
6- Owning shares of companies only - Activity Code 642051
7- Holding Activities Business Management Office - Activity Code 642070.
At the conclusion of the meeting, the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> extended his sincere thanks to the esteemed shareholders for their fruitful contributions and wished everyone progress and prosperity. May Allah grant success.
The meeting concluded at 12:00 PM.
Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Hadiya Holding Company <orig>شركة هدية القابضة</orig>, a Kuwaiti Closed Holding Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية قابضة مقفلة</orig>, was held at 12:15 AM on Monday, 07/07/2025, at the company's headquarters located in Sharq Area, Abdul Aziz Hamad Al-Saqr Street <orig>شارع عبد العزيز حمد الصقر</orig>, Al-Raya Tower 2 <orig>برج الراية 2</orig>, 41st Floor. **General Guidelines for the Practice:**

1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The tender document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- It is a condition for anyone applying for this practice to be among the qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and to attach a certificate to their tender to that effect, provided that its date is contemporary with the date of the practice's issuance.
4- This practice is (divisible), and the tenderer is not entitled to alternative offers unless the documents stipulate otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The tender must be accompanied by a preliminary security deposit of no less than (2%) two percent of the tender value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the tenderer and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Tenders not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required tender's validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (15 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice's works in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The tenderer accepts that their tender remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the tender's submission.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their tender categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their tender. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, or discrepancy (if found), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.

# Announcement

Regarding Practice No. (MK / 3 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
For printing and supplying school textbooks – Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector

The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school textbooks – Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to contractors approved by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة والصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with the certificate's date coinciding with the date of the practice's announcement.
4- This practice is (non-divisible), and bidders are not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (KWD 2000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the value of the bid. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the mentioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of print approval), during which the contractor undertakes to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the bid submission will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice documents, the contractor discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, provide answers, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the stipulated closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The contractor must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submit. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a bid unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with strict adherence to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The contractor must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>
