# Announcement
Announcement of Practice No. (MK / 6 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
For printing and supplying school textbooks – for the needs of / the Educational Research and Curricula Sector

The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school textbooks for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

## General Guidelines for the Practice:
1.  The (limited) practice is open to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2.  The tender document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3.  Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة والصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their tender confirming this, with a date concurrent with the date of the practice's offering.
4.  This practice is (non-divisible), and the tenderer is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5.  The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6.  The tender must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the value of the tender. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the tenderer and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Tenders not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required tender's validity.
7.  The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8.  The tenderer accepts that their tender shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the tender's submission.
9.  If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their tender categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their tender. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10. Practice documents shall be deposited in the tenders box at the Supplies and Stores Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No tender received after the prescribed closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted tenders received after the tender's submission be considered.
11. The practitioner must complete the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same tender documents they submitted. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept the tender unless the tables are completed in accordance with the public interest, with strict adherence to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12. The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.
    Please accept our highest regards,

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

# Announcement

Announcement of Practice No. (MK / 10 / 2025-2026 AD - Part 1)
for Printing and Supplying School Books - For the Needs of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector

The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the launch of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

General Instructions for the Practice:

1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement's publication.
3- It is a condition for those applying for this practice to be among the qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and to attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with dates contemporary to the date of the practice's launch.
4- This practice is (non-divisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (K.D. 2000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the value of the bid. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls will not be considered. The security must be valid for the required bid validity period.

# Announcement
## Announcement of Practice No. (MK / 12 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
### For Printing and Supplying School Textbooks for the Needs of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school textbooks for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

## General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry / Ghurfat Tijara wa Al-Sina'a Al-Kuwait <orig>غرفة تجارة والصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with a date concurrent with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars / Dinar Kuwaiti <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 K.D.) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars / Dinar Kuwaiti <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, of the bid value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait / Dawlat Al-Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of print approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid has been submitted.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice documents, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, provide answers, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department / Idarat Al-Tawridat wa Al-Makhazin <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subaihan / Subaihan Al-Janoubi <orig>صبيحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the scheduled closing time will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject of the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submit. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a bid unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the specifications and technical conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice (limited) is restricted to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The tender document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- It is a condition for anyone applying for this practice to be among the qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and to attach a certificate to their tender to that effect, provided that its date is contemporary with the date of the practice's issuance.
4- This practice is (indivisible) and the tenderer is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars / Dinar Kuwaiti <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
6- The tender must be accompanied by a preliminary security deposit of no less than (2000 KWD / Dinar Kuwaiti <orig>دك</orig>) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars / Dinar Kuwaiti <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the value of the tender. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the tenderer and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Tenders not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will not be considered. The security must be valid for the duration of the required tender's validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of print approval), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice's works in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The tenderer accepts that their tender shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the tender's submission.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their tender categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their tender. The Ministry will undertake to study these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), and no additional responsibility or obligation shall arise for the Ministry as a result.
10- The practice documents shall be deposited in the tender box at the Supplies and Stores Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan area <orig>منطقة صبحان الجنوبي</orig> during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No tender received after the prescribed closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted tenders received after the tender's submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same tender documents they submitted. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept the tender unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the specifications and technical conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all banking guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

# Announcement
Announcement of Practice No. (MK / 21 / 2025-2026 AD - Part 1)
For printing and supplying school textbooks - Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school textbooks -
Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications stated
in the practice documents.

## General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- It is a condition for those applying for this practice to be among the qualified printing presses, registered in
the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and to attach a certificate
to that effect with their bid, provided that its date is contemporary with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers
unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD <orig>دك</orig>) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only,
and this security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of
guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of
the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not
accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will not be considered,
and the security must be valid for the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which

8- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable,

The Ministry will undertake to study these observations and inquiries, answer them, and remove any
error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), and no responsibility
or additional obligation will arise for the Ministry as a result.
10- The practice documents shall be deposited in the bid box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig>

:30 PM) according to the decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or setting the closing time.
No bid received after the scheduled closing time will be accepted, nor will
any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies
for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents
submitted. The Ministry has the right not to accept the bid unless it includes the filled tables

## Announcement

Announcement of Practice No. (MK / 24 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
for printing and supplying school textbooks - requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school textbooks -
requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained
in the practice documents.

### General Guidelines for the Practice:

1- The practice is (limited) to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the
Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة والصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate
to their bid confirming this, with a date contemporary to the date of the practice's offering.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers
unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The fee for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only,
and no more than the value of the bid. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter
of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the
Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not
accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned regulations,
will not be considered. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of print approval), during which the
contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions,
and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable
and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No
price reduction after the submission of the bid will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the
technical documents or in the quantity schedules that may affect their bid categories or the
value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid.
The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any
error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility
or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig>
in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM),
according to the decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or setting the closing date.
No bid received after the stipulated closing time will be accepted, nor will any
amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies
for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents
they submit. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a bid unless it includes the filled tables
in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions
of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

# Announcement
## Announcement of Practice No. (MMK / 30 / 2025 - 2026 AD - Part 1) for Printing and Supplying School Books - For the Needs of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector

The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

**General Guidelines for the Practice:**

1- The practice is (limited) to contractors approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid to that effect, with its date coinciding with the date of the practice's offering.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, of the bid value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the mentioned controls, will not be considered. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the bid submission will be considered.
9- If the contractor, upon reviewing the practice, finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- The practice documents shall be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Stores Department in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to the decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the scheduled closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The contractor must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submitted. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a bid unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The contractor must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

# Announcement

## Announcement of Practice No. (MMK / 36 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)

For printing and supplying school textbooks – for the needs of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the launch of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school textbooks for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with a date concurrent with the date of the practice's launch.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, of the bid value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the bid submission will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the stipulated closing time will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submitted. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a bid unless it includes the completed tables in accordance with the public interest, with a strict adherence to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all banking guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

# Announcement

Announcement of Practice No. (MK / 42 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
for printing and supplying school textbooks - for the needs of / the Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school textbooks
for the needs of / the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained
in the practice documents.

General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- It is stipulated that whoever applies for this practice must be one of the qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid to that effect, provided that its date is contemporary with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, of the bid value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will not be considered. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20) days from the date of print approval, during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid has been submitted.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- The practice documents shall be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to the decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the scheduled closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submitted. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a bid unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

## General Guidelines for the Practice:

1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The tender document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their tender confirming this, with a date concurrent with the date of issuing the practice.
4- This practice is (non-divisible), and the tenderer is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The tender must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2,000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, of the tender value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the tenderer and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Tenders not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the mentioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required tender's validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of print approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications stated in the practice documents.
8- The tenderer accepts that their tender remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the tender has been submitted.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their tender categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their tender. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, deficiency, or discrepancy (if found), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- The practice documents must be deposited in the tenders box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No tender received after the scheduled closing date will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted tenders received after the tender submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same tender documents they submitted. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a tender unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with a strict adherence to the specifications and technical conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2,000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, of the bid value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bid and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the mentioned controls, will not be considered. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid's validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid's submission.
9- If, upon studying the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the quantity schedules that may affect their bid categories or the actual value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. ## Announcement

Regarding Tender No. (MK / 53 / 2025-2026 AD) Part 1 for Printing and Supplying School Books – for the needs of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the issuance of a (limited) tender for printing and supplying school books for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.

This insurance must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. 11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject of the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submitted. The Ministry has the right not to accept the bid unless the tables are filled in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to what is stated in the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

# Announcement

Regarding Practice No. (MK / 62 / 2025-2026 AD) Part 1 for printing and supplying school books - requirement of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>

The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the launch of a (limited) practice concerning the printing and supply of school books, a requirement of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

General Guidelines for the Practice:

1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The tender document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to that effect with their tender, provided that its date is contemporary with the date of the practice's launch.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the tenderer is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The tender must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the value of the tender. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the tenderer and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Tenders not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the required tender validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The tenderer must ensure that their tender remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the tender has been submitted.
9- If the practitioner, upon studying the practice, finds any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their tender categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their tender. The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> will undertake to study these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, deficiency, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), and no additional responsibility or obligation shall arise for the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> as a result.
10- The practice documents shall be deposited in the tenders box at the Supplies and Stores Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> regarding changing or extending the closing date. No tender received after the scheduled closing date will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted tenders be considered after the tender has been submitted.

This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the launch of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books - a requirement for the Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

General Instructions for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة والصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid, dated concurrently with the date of the practice's launch.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2,000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the bid value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total contract period is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the bid submission will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the quantity schedules that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any). This shall not entail any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the bid box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subaihan <orig>صبيحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM) noon, according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the stipulated closing date will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted bids received after bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submit. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a bid unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with strict adherence to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all banking guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Announcement

Regarding Practice No. (MK / 77 / 2025-2026 AD) Part 1 for Printing and Supplying School Books – Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books – requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector <orig>قطاع البحوث التربوية والمناهج</orig>, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

General Instructions for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The tender document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to that effect with their tender, dated concurrently with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the tenderer is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The tender must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2,000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, of the tender value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the tenderer and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Tenders not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required tender validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of print approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The tenderer accepts that their tender remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the submission of the tender will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their tender categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their tender. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, deficiency, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the tender box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No tender received after the stipulated closing date will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted tenders received after the tender submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same tender documents submitted. The Ministry reserves the right not to accept a tender unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the specifications and technical conditions of the practice.

Announcement
Regarding Practice No. (MK / 82 / 2025-2026 AD) Part 1 for Printing
and Supplying School Books - Special / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying
special school books / Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained
in the practice documents.
General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to practitioners approved by the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid to that effect, dated concurrently with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2,000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the value of the bid. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the mentioned regulations, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the submission of the bid will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, provide answers, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in South Sulaibiya <orig>صبيحان الجنوبي</orig> during official working hours, no later than 12:30 PM, according to the decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or setting the closing date. No bid received after the stipulated closing time will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submitted. The Ministry has the right to reject the bid unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

# Announcement
Regarding Practice No. (MMK / 88 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
For printing and supplying school books – Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector

The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books – Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

## General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with a date concurrent with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, from the value of the bid. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the mentioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of print approval), during which the contractor is committed to executing the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid submission.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the quantity schedules that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, deficiency, discrepancy, or conflict (if any). This will not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in a bid box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in South Subaihan <orig>صبيحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (12:30 PM), according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or extending the closing date. No bid received after the scheduled closing time will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of bids submitted after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry has the right to reject any bid that does not include the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, while adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

Announcement

Regarding Practice No. (MK / 112 / 2025 - 2026 AD - Part 1)
For printing and supplying school books - for the needs of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to their bid confirming this, with a date concurrent with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 KD) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the value of the bid. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the submission of the bid will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- The practice documents must be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than 12:30 PM, according to the Ministry's decisions regarding changing or setting the closing date. No bid received after the stipulated closing time will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents they submitted. The Ministry has the right to reject the bid unless it includes the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.

12- The practitioner must submit all banking guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

Announcement
Regarding Practice No. (MK / 118 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
For printing and supplying school books – Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books –
Requirement / Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained
in the practice documents.

General Guidelines for the Practice:
1- The practice is (limited) to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- It is a condition for those applying for this practice to be among the qualified printing presses, registered in
the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and to attach a certificate
to that effect with their bid, provided that its date is contemporary with the date of offering the practice.
4- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers
unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of not less than (K.D. 2000) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only,
and no more, of the bid value, and this security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of
guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Ministry of
Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this
security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will not be considered. The
security must be valid for the required bid validity period.
7- The total duration of the contract is (20 days from the date of printing approval), during which the
contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, conditions, and technical specifications
contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid remains valid and effective, irrevocable,
and cannot be withdrawn from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No
price reduction after the submission of the bid will be considered.
9- If the practitioner, upon studying the practice, finds any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the
technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the
value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The
Ministry will undertake to study these observations and inquiries, answer them, and remove any error,
deficiency, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), and this will not result in any additional responsibility or obligation
on the Ministry.
10- The practice documents shall be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in the area of
South Subhan Industrial Area <orig>صبحان الصناعية جنوبي</orig> during official working hours, no later than 12:30 PM,
according to the decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or setting the closing date. No bid received after the
scheduled closing time will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies
required for the execution of the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents
submitted. The Ministry has the right not to accept the bid unless it includes the tables filled in according to
the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to what is stated in the technical specifications and conditions
of the practice.
Sunday, 25 Muharram 1447 AH – 2025/7/20 AD
12- The practitioner must submit all banking guarantees related to this practice in the Arabic language.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

# Announcement

Regarding Practice No. (MK / 128 / 2025-2026 AD – Part 1)
For printing and supplying school books – for the needs of / Educational Research and Curricula Sector
The Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces the offering of a (limited) practice for printing and supplying school books for the needs of the Educational Research and Curricula Sector, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.

## General Instructions for the Practice:

1- The practice is (limited) to approved practitioners registered with the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- The bid document must be submitted within 10 working days from the date of the announcement.
3- Applicants for this practice must be qualified printing presses, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year, and must attach a certificate to that effect with their bid, dated concurrently with the date of the practice's offering.
4- This practice is (divisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state otherwise.
5- The financial cost for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>.
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of not less than (2%) two percent of the bid value. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank approved by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder, in favor of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by security that violates any of the aforementioned regulations, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the duration of the required bid validity period.
7- The total contract period is (15) days from the date of approval of (printing), during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special terms, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
8- The bidder accepts that their bid shall remain valid and effective, irrevocable and non-withdrawable, from its submission date until the end of its validity period. No price reduction after the bid submission will be considered.
9- If, upon reviewing the practice documents, the practitioner discovers any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the bills of quantities that may affect their bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will review these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), without incurring any additional responsibility or obligation on the Ministry.
10- Practice documents must be deposited in the bids box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than 12:30 PM, according to decisions issued by the Ministry regarding changing or setting the closing date. No bid received after the scheduled closing time will be accepted, nor will any amendment to the prices of submitted bids received after the bid submission be considered.
11- The practitioner must fill in the attached tables and provide a statement of all necessary supplies for executing the works subject to the practice (if any) within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry reserves the right to reject any bid that does not include the filled tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to what is stipulated in the technical specifications and conditions of the practice.
12- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees related to this practice in Arabic.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education / Wizarat Al-Tarbiya <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

## Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
# Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> - Medical Supplies Control <orig>مراقبة اللوازم الطبية</orig>) announces the offering of the following practices:

<table_caption>Ministry of Health Tenders for Medical Supplies</table_caption>
<table>
| Practice No. | Description                                                                      | Fees | Closing Date | Publication Date |
|:-------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:-----|:-------------|:-----------------|
| 5EN010       | ENT examination consumables required for departments in health centers and hospitals | 75     | 4/8/2025     | 20/7/2025        |
</table>

Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:
1- The local company must be registered with the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register.
2- The local company must specialize in the medical field and be documented with an accredited certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
3- When submitting an offer, two booklets and two different receipts must be purchased.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical Drugs <orig>إدارة التسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية</orig> or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and material's registration in the suppliers' register at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> as part of the bid contents (specific to drug control).
5- Submit samples of new materials, whether a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, for specialized control (drugs - medical supplies).
6- Attach a certificate of national labor support percentage.
7- Practice documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> official website.
8- The fee for purchasing the booklet can be paid from the website to be attached with the practice documents.
9- Submit price offers in a sealed envelope, including the practice documents, according to the closing date specified on the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> official website.

## Births and Deaths Committee Meeting
### Minutes of the Births and Deaths Committee Meeting
Held on 22/06/2025

After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in the birth and death registers, the committee decided to make the amendment listed below in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the registers, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment: The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 69/36 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 2021/1650, met.

*   Mr. / Director of the Central Births and Deaths Registry Department <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Chairman
*   Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Deaths Department <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> - Member

The secretarial duties of the committee were performed by Ms. Shukriya Al-Duraie <orig>شكرية الدريعي</orig>.

The committee reviewed requests from number ((216)) to number ((234)) in the attached list, pertaining to data amendment in birth and death registers for birth and death registration applications.
